results.title: Two nights
results.creator_credit: Rolmar Baldonado, Lisa Lloyd and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Over two nights, a young Chinese immigrant has sexual encounters with two very different individuals. Consequently, he has to choose between the one he wants or the one who wants him.

results.title: Two mules for Sister Sara
results.creator_credit: Don Siegel, Carroll Case, Martin Rackin and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Two Mules for Sister Sara is a freewheeling, anarchic adventure set in a French-occupied Mexico in the 19th century. An American mercenary (Clint Eastwood) rescues a nun (Shirley Maclaine) from her would-be-molesters, only to later discover that the chance meeting has been a stroke of luck for him, as she knows a great deal about the officers in the garrison he plans to invade. As they embark on a journey together, there develops a sexual tension between the two which comes to an explosive end together with the garrison under attack. Includes a musical score by Ennio Morricone.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Don Siegel, Carroll Case, Martin Rackin and Universal Pictures

results.title: Two mountain lands: Andes and Alps
results.creator_credit: Andrew B. Nemes, Learning Corporation of America and Audio Visual Productions
results.brief_description: Contrasts the life of a Swiss Alpine dairy farmer with that of a terrace farmer from the Peruvian Andes. Shows differences in farming methods, transportation systems, traditions and economic structures. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Andrew B. Nemes, Learning Corporation of America and Audio Visual Productions

results.title: Two men of Fiji
results.creator_credit: Brett Porter, Bern Gandy and Shell Film Unit
results.brief_description: Jaile and Adriu lived on Kakeba Island in the Lay group.Adriu left to study medicine in Suva and his friend Jaile crept away to join him. But Jaile soon found that life in Suva was lonely and difficult for an island boy. Back home he found his place again, working among things he knew, with his friends.

results.title: Two little frosts
results.brief_description: An animated story in the style of a folk tale in which man is pitted against the elements. The personified frost creatures assume that an old man will fall easily prey to their ability to freeze. Despite all their efforts, the experienced woodman unknowingly defeats the two little frosts.

results.title: Two little ears
results.creator_credit: John Dick, Lesley Hammond, Bosisto Productions and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
This documentary looks at the way mentally handicapped children engage with music as a form of expression. It depicts interview footage with the adult carer juxtaposed with scenes of the children singing and dancing.
Suitable for teacher/tertiary level.

results.title: Two laws. Part 4: Living with two laws (A)
results.brief_description: Part 4 of the innovative film “Two laws”, on the Borroloola people’s struggle for the recognition of Aboriginal law. Aborigines actively collaborated with the filmmakers in determining the form of the film. This part describes the present movement by the Aboriginal people back to traditional land, the assertion of ceremonial practice and the setting up of cattle out-stations. The other parts of the film are: “Police times”, “Welfare times” and “Struggle for our land”. Made with the assistance of the Australian Film Commission.

results.title: Two laws. Part 3: Struggle for our land (A)
results.creator_credit: Alessandro Cavadini, Carolyn Strachan and Australian Film Commission
results.brief_description: Part 3 of the feature film “Two laws”. Describes Aboriginal attachment to land, conflict over sacred sites, the 1977 Borroloola land claim and the bargaining strategy of the people with the government, the cattle stations and the mining company. The other parts of the film are “Police times”, “Welfare times”, “Living with two laws”. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Two laws. Part 2: Welfare times (A)
results.creator_credit: Alessandro Cavadini, Carolyn Strachan and Australian Film Commission
results.brief_description: Part 2 of the docudrama “Two laws”. Describes the life of the Borroloola community under the welfare system of the 1950s to the present day. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
